functional_summary.core_purpose: A tool to analyze and structure Product Requirements Documents (PRDs) into concise, actionable JSON summaries, highlighting core functionality, user value, and business alignment.
key_features: Automated extraction of app purpose, features, and user actions from PRD text
Standardized JSON output for easy integration into development workflows
Focus on user value proposition and success metrics
primary_user_actions: Review and export the parsed output
technical_requirements: Natural Language Processing (NLP) for text parsing
Secure data handling for user inputs
user_personas: Product Managers seeking quick PRD overviews
Developers needing structured specs for implementation
business_goals: Streamline product development by reducing PRD analysis time
Improve cross-team alignment through standardized outputs
success_metrics: Accuracy of extracted features (target: 90%+ match to original PRD)
User adoption rate and time saved per PRD parse

project_scope.reason: The PRD Parser Tool is a web-based application focused on a linear workflow (input PRD text, generate JSON, review/export) that can be implemented as a single interactive page with multiple components, such as an input form, processing button, output display, and export options, without needing distinct multi-screen navigation.

context_gaps.recommended_next_action: Generate comprehensive design brief with AI assistance

inspiration_sources.name: Minimalist Productivity Tools
inspiration_sources.style: Clean, whitespace-dominant layouts with subtle shadows, rounded corners, and a focus on readability using sans-serif fonts and neutral palettes
inspiration_sources.reasoning: This style emphasizes simplicity and clarity, ideal for parsing and structuring complex PRDs into actionable JSON, reducing cognitive load for users focused on efficiency and quick insights

inspiration_sources.name: Developer-Centric IDEs
inspiration_sources.style: Dark-mode friendly with monospaced typography for code-like elements, sharp edges, and accents in greens or blues to highlight technical outputs like JSON structures
inspiration_sources.reasoning: It mirrors the technical nature of JSON outputs and dev workflows, providing a familiar, focused environment that aligns with the tool's purpose of integrating into development processes

inspiration_sources.name: Professional Collaboration Platforms
inspiration_sources.style: Structured grids, bold hierarchical typography, and a balanced color scheme with professional blues and grays, incorporating subtle icons and cards for organized content display
inspiration_sources.reasoning: This approach supports business alignment and user value propositions by evoking trust and organization, suitable for product managers reviewing features, metrics, and actionable summaries

design_brief.blended_style: Combine the minimalist tools' emphasis on whitespace and readability with the developer IDEs' technical precision in typography and dark mode support, layered with the collaboration platforms' structured grids and professional hierarchy; result in a versatile, mixed-theme interface that prioritizes clean JSON visualization, intuitive navigation, and subtle professional polish for seamless workflow integration
ui_principles: Consistency in component patterns for quick parsing
Feedback via subtle states to confirm actions
design_brief.motion_style: Minimal micro-animations like smooth fades for JSON rendering and hover expansions on feature cards, ensuring responsiveness without overwhelming the professional focus
design_brief.emotional_tone: Confident and streamlined, transforming dense PRD analysis into an intuitive, rewarding process that instills a sense of control and productivity
design_brief.target_audience: Product managers, developers, and business stakeholders who handle PRDs daily, seeking tools that bridge documentation with actionable development without unnecessary complexity
accessibility_focus: WCAG 2.1 AA compliance with adjustable contrast
Full keyboard and screen reader support for interactive elements

data_flow: Unidirectional data flow with props and callbacks

build_requirements: Text parsing with regex or NLP library

design_intent.visual_philosophy: The visual philosophy of the PRD Parser Tool embodies a mixed-theme approach that harmoniously blends the airy simplicity of minimalist productivity tools, the precise, code-inspired aesthetics of developer IDEs, and the structured professionalism of collaboration platforms, resulting in a clean, dark-mode compatible interface dominated by whitespace, neutral palettes accented by #2563EB blue, and monospaced typography for JSON elements; this design prioritizes intuitive hierarchy, subtle micro-animations, and WCAG-compliant accessibility to transform complex PRD analysis into visually digestible, actionable insights that feel efficient, precise, and empowering for technical and business users.
design_anchors: Clarity through hierarchical typography and generous whitespace to reduce cognitive load in parsing JSON structures
Consistency in modular components and color usage for seamless integration across minimalist and technical elements
Precision in feedback mechanisms, such as subtle shadows, rounded corners, and state-based animations, to enhance usability without distraction
user_experience_goals: Empower users with a streamlined, confident workflow that quickly converts dense PRDs into rewarding, actionable JSON summaries
Foster productivity by providing an intuitive, accessible interface that bridges documentation with development, minimizing complexity for product managers and developers
design_intent.brand_alignment: The design aligns with the brand's values of efficiency, precision, and empowerment by leveraging a professional yet approachable aesthetic that instills trust through organized grids and technical familiarity, while the neutral palette with blue accents and Inter/JetBrains Mono typography reinforces a sense of control and streamlined productivity in handling PRDs, directly supporting business alignment and user value propositions.
technical_constraints: Adherence to WCAG 2.1 AA standards, including adjustable contrast ratios and full keyboard/screen reader support for all interactive JSON rendering and navigation elements
Implementation of dark-mode toggling with monospaced fonts to maintain readability in code-like outputs, while ensuring cross-browser compatibility for developer workflows
scalability_considerations: Modular component library based on the blended style to easily accommodate future features like advanced PRD analytics or multi-document parsing without redesign
Responsive grid systems and vector-based icons to support expansion across devices, from desktop IDE integrations to mobile stakeholder reviews
maintenance_guidelines: Enforce strict adherence to the defined visual system (e.g., primary #2563EB, support colors) and typography scale in all updates to preserve consistency
Regular audits for accessibility and motion performance, with documentation of UI principles to guide iterative improvements and team contributions
success_criteria: Achieve high user satisfaction scores (e.g., >4.5/5) in usability testing for JSON visualization clarity and workflow efficiency among target audience
Ensure 100% WCAG 2.1 AA compliance and seamless performance in rendering complex PRD summaries, validated through automated tools and stakeholder feedback
